author: blogs.wsj.com
title: Perfect Position (Crossword Contest, May 4)
text:
157 COMMENTS Download PDF
Please donâ€™t post any spoilers until after the contest deadline.
PLAY PRINT SHOW COMMENTS HIDE COMMENTS (157) Failed to load comments 157 comments Get Livefyre FAQ Sign in + Follow Post comment Link Newest | Oldest Sherman Uitzetter subscriber 5pts
I found a verb. Hope it's the right one!
Jay Miller subscriber 5pts
Not a typical Marie Kelly puzzle--way too easy.
Jack Sullivan user 5pts
I'm on the beach, he said, with trepidation.
Arnold Brockman subscriber 5pts
I Am On Shore...Pretty Sure !
Philip Egan subscriber 5pts
I'm ashore after a relatively easy swim. So easy that I am nervous to some extent. But, my answer is a "most excellent" fit
Dave Darrah subscriber 5pts
Think I've got it. The 'aha' moment for this one is nowhere near the magnitude of others. And Robert, or whoever is handling the stats this week: You can call me Al, uh, no, wait, you can call me OGuyDave!
MIKE MILLER staff 5pts
An update to my post below: I am now hearing that the comments on this and other WSJ blogs may not be ready Monday morning. We will get them back up ASAP. Let's make this plan: As soon as they're up, we'll continue the contest conversation on the comments for whatever is the most recent daily crossword.
The workings of the contest are unaffected. Same ways to submit an answer. We'll still notify a winner on Monday.
Thanks for bearing with us--apologies again for the disruption of this delightful forum! Robert Stevens subscriber 5pts
@ MIKE MILLER Good luck. Software changes are always a challenge MIKE MILLER staff 5pts
@ Robert Stevens @ MIKE MILLER Thanks! And thanks for being such a great captain of this crew.
Barbara Koehler subscriber 5pts
@ MIKE MILLER Nice that you arranged to have an easy puzzle the week of the software change so people won't be desperate for explanations after midnight Sunday.
Arnold Brockman subscriber 5pts
Robert-
Are You Going On A Danube River Cruise???-If So- Best Vacation We Ever Had
Robert Stevens subscriber 5pts
@ Arnold Brockman We are gong by land with Overseas Adventure Travel. We talked about the pros and cons of a land vs river cruise and went for land. I am sure either would be a great choice.
Juliet Cole user 5pts
In spite of rumors that there's pageantry involved, I'm confident that the meta is clearly revealed, and confirmed by the title. I'm confident enough to head for shore where I will be enjoying the sun, sand, waves, and refreshing beverages. Until midnight Sunday!
MIKE MILLER staff 5pts
All--an important announcement about some work underway on the WSJ.com commenting tools that will affect this discussion.
The site is switching to a new commenting platform that we think/hope is even better than this one.
The comments on this site will be disabled at midnight Sunday night (Sunday into Monday). You'll still be able to read the comments but not add new ones.
We will continue this conversation in the comments for the Monday puzzle, right here at wsj.com/puzzles. That should be ready for comments on the new platform at 7am eastern time Monday. (As I understand it, there will be a period from midnight to 7am eastern time when neither puzzle will take comments.)
Apologies for the disruption! Consider it another puzzle for us all to solve.
Many thanks and good luck with the contest,
Mike
Diana Breithaupt user 5pts
@ MIKE MILLER
Is this because of my last song? "No more stupid songs! We are changing the format." I knew I shouldn't have posted that.
Barbara Koehler subscriber 5pts
@ Diana Breithaupt @ MIKE MILLER More likely because your songs are such an important part of the board they're changing it to make it more music-friendly!
Tom Shea subscriber 5pts
On shore and starting a new winning streak (I hope). I hope Isaac didn't get used to my heavy tipping (and tippling) during the month of April.
There is a second level to the most obvious answer by my reckoning.
Congratulations to Robert. Enjoy the vacation, and again many thanks for being the cruise director for this community.
FRIDA CHEN user 5pts
@ Tom Shea You're the first to mention this. Now you've gotten a lot of people worried.
Tom Shea subscriber 5pts
@ FRIDA CHEN
Don't worry. In fact, be re-assured. I still think it is the answer most people have come to. Not really a second level (apologies for creating worry), just a second arrow to the answer.
Barbara Koehler subscriber 5pts
@ Tom Shea I do not see another level, but the approach that worked was the second one I tried. The first did not lead to a four letter verb.
Robert Stevens subscriber 5pts
The shuttles from the ship to the shore have been steady since 4:15 yesterday. At present we have 52 on the shore and overflowing into the shire.
If there is a second level, unlike Pageant, no one has indicated it - yet FRIDA CHEN user 5pts
@ Robert Stevens 1st mention was just made by Tom
Doug Morack user 5pts
On shore. Now back to the MMMM while I wait for the MGWCC.
I took a look at what I wrote above and realized I sounded like an addict. Is there a Meta Anonymous group that meets regularly? I even got my Dad involved in this weeks' MMMM. AAAH! Now I'm a dealer!
Robert Stevens subscriber 5pts
@ Doug Morack this is certainly a meta support group - whether we should worry about addiction and/or being a dealer is another question
FRIDA CHEN user 5pts
@ Doug Morack I'm a dealer, too. I've gotten one fully addicted. Some others are much younger and aren't even crossword puzzle addicts but they love the concept of the "hidden" meta and ask me to share the ones I think they could get....after I've filled in the grid for them and already know the solution..
MATTHEW BASTIAN subscriber 5pts
Ashore! (And after being briefly distracted by a second, very defensible answer...we might have another PAGEANT week on our hands, folks.)
Robert Stevens subscriber 5pts
@ MATTHEW BASTIAN If you are correct, there will be a lot of us on the wrong shore. But with pageant, muggles started commenting that there was a deeper answer. that has not happened - yet
Aan Moser subscriber 5pts
Like many others, I think I'm on shore, but not 100% certain.The solution fits with the meta topic and the clues. So, I'm claiming beach time and, come Monday, hope I don't find out I was only on a sandbar.
Harry Reis user 5pts
I suppose this is nit picking but technically the grid answer to 10D is wrong. The airport is not located in that city but rather nearby, and is officially (and deliberately) located between it and another well-known city.
Robert Stevens subscriber 5pts
@ Harry Reis Harry - that is probably true for most airports but for the sake of crossword puzzlers, the answer is always what is given in 10D Diana Breithaupt user 5pts
@ Robert Stevens @ Harry Reis This reminds of the time I posted SFO wasn't the correct airport for the Niners touchdown clue, and someone argued with me. It could have been you Robert. That was long, long time ago. I couldn't say anything about why it was not correct because we aren't allowed to give spoilers to the meta grid. But it still festered in my mind until after the meta was revealed and then I actually bothered to come back and say how the Niners are based in Santa Clara and San Jose was closer than San Francisco, blah, blah, blah. I was so ridiculous to care. But Harry's post brings back fond memories. I'm laughing to myself how mad I got about that.
Robert Stevens subscriber 5pts
@ Diana Breithaupt @ Robert Stevens @ Harry Reis Diana - I remember that well but it was not moi. I did not know where the 49'ers flew out of.
The Patriots fly out of Providence. Closer to the stadium and probably cheaper to keep the plane. JOSEPH MICHAEL subscriber 5pts
I wonder if it ever happens that there is a "correct" answer that wasn't intended by the puzzle designer? yet fits all the clues?
Cynthia Weatherman subscriber 5pts
@ JOSEPH MICHAEL Of course there is but it is still wrong. See Pageant! LOL!
Richard L Johnson subscriber 5pts
(Cynthia) Solved. I think.
JOSEPH MICHAEL subscriber 5pts
Ah, if I am sharp enough, I think I have it.
Nice example of how a met works, if I am correct.
Barbara Koehler subscriber 5pts
I finally got this week's MMMM. I'd had all the pieces right in front of me for over a day before a whack from a two by four helped me take the final step.
And if I may brag a little, I've joined Al and Beth as early solvers of the mega meta.
Robert Stevens subscriber 5pts
@ Barbara Koehler You are in elite company
Eric Conrad user 5pts
I was staring at the MMMM mega-meta (I think I am on the trail, but have lost two points to bad guesses), and forgot about the WSJ yesterday. I just solved the WSJ, and am on shore.
I loved the clue for 63A.
Dan Coombes user 5pts
We discussed it, then slept on it. We woke up to the sound of waves crashing onto the shore. Gonna be a great weekend!
PETER LEE subscriber 5pts
One of the few metas that helped me solve the grid. Ashore.
George Findling subscriber 5pts
On shore. Been travelling recently, so I'm a bit absent from the weekly roster.
M Lembo user 5pts
Done and done. Looking for that 'perfect position' with a little shade, a cool breeze and the tiki hut in sight!
To all, a great weekend!
Mary Flaminio user 5pts
on shore! Yippee!
Cynthia Weatherman subscriber 5pts
Alas, another week with no mug and since I don't have an email from MGWCC, I assume another month with no pens. We may soon need a spreadsheet and support group for Muggles with the most solves and no wins from WSJ or MGWCC.
But, I must say I was pleasantly surprised with the prizes for my Fireball win. A ball cap and SEVEN autographed Peter Gordon puzzle books! I am enjoying my lunch more than ever as I eat and solve. If you are not a subscriber, now is the time. Next week is a meta!
For those of you looking for the click on MMMM, I suspect you are right on the edge of a solution.
Robert, we will miss you while you are traveling. You will still solve the puzzle, correct? If you need tips on ways to secure a copy while traveling, several of us would be glad to give you pointers. Hotel front desks, boarding pass printers - any of those will do.
I would volunteer but this is my busiest month of the year at work. I hope someone will volunteer to be your stand-in.
Doug Morack user 5pts
@ Cynthia Weatherman I'm having trouble closing the deal on the MMMM. I believe I have six of the seven "answers" and those pieces can be arranged into the name of a band in the RRHoF, but I'd sure like to confirm that last one before I submit my answer. By the way, I really liked the puzzle construction.
Cynthia Weatherman subscriber 5pts
@ Doug Morack @ Cynthia Weatherman H take a closer look before you submit. Do you know someone who could confirm or deny your answer?
Robert Stevens subscriber 5pts
@ Cynthia Weatherman Cynthia - do you know how to say "print me the WSJ crossword contest" in Czech, Slovakian and Hungarian? Cynthia Weatherman subscriber 5pts
@ Robert Stevens @ Cynthia Weatherman Google translate!
Robert Stevens subscriber 5pts
@ Cynthia Weatherman @ Robert Stevens Unfortunately, bring language handicapped, I have two problems 1) with some of those languages the pronunciation is a challenge and 2) my ability to remember a foreign language longer than 1/10 sec is non existent.
